verses.t: Then{G1161} came he{G2658} to{G1519} Derbe{G1191} and{G2532} Lystra{G3082}: and{G2532}, behold{G2400}, a certain{G5100} disciple{G3101} was{G2258} there{G1563}, named{G3686} Timotheus{G5095}, the son{G5207} of a certain{G5100} woman{G1135}, which was a Jewess{G2453}, and believed{G4103}; but{G1161} his father{G3962} was a Greek{G1672}:
Which{G3739} was well reported{G3140} of{G5259} by the brethren{G80} that were{G3588} at{G1722} Lystra{G3082} and{G2532} Iconium{G2430}.

Him{G5126} would{G2309} Paul{G3588} have to go forth{G1831} with{G4862} him{G846}; and{G2532} took{G2983} and circumcised{G4059} him{G846} because{G1223} of the Jews{G2453} which were{G5607} in{G1722} those{G1565} quarters{G3588}: for{G1063} they knew{G1492} all{G537} that{G3754} his{G846} father{G3588} was{G5225} a Greek{G1672}.

And{G1161} as{G5613} they went through{G1279} the cities{G3588}, they delivered{G3860} them{G846} the decrees{G3588} for to keep{G5442}, that were ordained{G2919} of{G5259} the apostles{G3588} and{G2532} elders{G4245} which were{G3588} at{G1722} Jerusalem{G2419}.
And{G3303} so{G3767} were{G4732} the churches{G1577} established{G4732} in{G2596} the faith{G3588}, and{G2532} increased{G4052} in number{G3588} daily{G2250}.

Now{G1161} when they had gone throughout{G1330} Phrygia{G3588} and{G2532} the region{G5561} of Galatia{G1054}, and were forbidden{G2967} of{G5259} the Holy{G40} Ghost{G4151} to preach{G2980} the word{G3588} in{G1722} Asia{G3588},
After{G2596} they were come{G2064} to Mysia{G3588}, they assayed{G3985} to go{G4198} into{G2596} Bithynia{G3588}: but{G2532} the Spirit{G3588} suffered{G1439} them{G846} not{G3756}.
And{G1161} they passing{G3928} by Mysia{G3588} came down{G2597} to{G1519} Troas{G5174}.

And{G2532}a vision{G3705} appeared{G3700} to Paul{G3588} in{G1223} the night{G3588}; There stood{G2476} a man{G435} of Macedonia{G3110}, and{G2532} prayed{G3870} him{G846}, saying{G3004}, Come over{G1224} into{G1519} Macedonia{G3109}, and help{G997} us{G2254}.

And{G1161} after{G5613} he had seen{G1492} the vision{G3588}, immediately{G2112} we endeavoured{G2212} to go{G1831} into{G1519} Macedonia{G3588}, assuredly gathering{G4822} that{G3754} the Lord{G3588} had called{G4341} us{G2248} for to preach the gospel{G2097} unto them{G846}.
Therefore{G3767} loosing{G321} from{G575} Troas{G3588}, we came with a straight course{G2113} to{G1519} Samothracia{G4543}, and{G5037} the next{G1966} day to{G1519} Neapolis{G3496};

And{G5037} from thence{G1564} to{G1519} Philippi{G5375}, which{G3748} is{G2076} the chief{G4413} city{G4172} of that part{G3588} of Macedonia{G3588}, and a colony{G2862}: and{G1161} we were{G1510} in{G1722} that{G3778} city{G3588} abiding{G1304} certain{G5100} days{G2250}.

And{G5037} on the sabbath{G3588} we went{G1831} out of{G1854} the city{G3588} by{G3844} a river side{G4215}, where{G3757} prayer{G4335} was wont{G3543} to be made{G1511}; and{G2532} we sat down{G2523}, and spake{G2980} unto the women{G1135} which{G3588} resorted{G4905} thither.

And{G2532} a certain{G5100} woman{G1135} named{G3686} Lydia{G3070}, a seller of purple{G4211}, of the city{G4172} of Thyatira{G2363}, which{G3739} worshipped{G4576} God{G3588}, heard{G191} us: whose heart{G3588} the Lord{G3588} opened{G1272}, that she attended unto{G4337} the things which{G3588} were spoken{G2980} of{G5259} Paul{G3588}.

And{G1161} when{G5613} she was baptized{G907}, and{G2532} her{G846} household{G3588}, she besought{G3870} us, saying{G3004}, If{G1487} ye have judged{G2919} me{G3165} to be{G1511} faithful{G4103} to the Lord{G3588}, come{G1525} into{G1519} my{G3450} house{G3588}, and abide{G3306} there. And{G2532} she constrained{G3849} us{G2248}.

And{G1161} it came to pass{G1096}, as we{G2257} went{G4198} to{G1519} prayer{G4335}, a certain{G5100} damsel{G3814} possessed{G2192} with a spirit{G4151} of divination{G4436} met{G528} us{G2254}, which{G3748} brought{G3930} her{G846} masters{G3588} much{G4183} gain{G2039} by soothsaying{G3132}:

The same{G3778} followed{G2628} Paul{G3588} and{G2532} us{G2254}, and cried{G2896}, saying{G3004}, These{G3778} men{G3588} are{G1526} the servants{G1401} of the most high{G5310} God{G3588}, which{G3748} shew unto{G2605} us{G2254} the way{G3598} of salvation{G4991}.

And{G1161} this{G5124} did she{G4160} many{G4183} days{G2250}. But{G1161} Paul{G3588}, being grieved{G1278}, turned{G1994} and{G2532} said{G2036} to the spirit{G3588}, I command{G3853} thee{G4671} in{G1722} the name{G3588} of Jesus{G2424} Christ{G5547} to come out{G1831} of{G575} her{G846}. And{G2532} he came out{G1831} the same{G846} hour{G3588}.

And{G1161} when her{G846} masters{G3588} saw{G1492} that{G3754} the hope{G3588} of their{G846} gains{G3588} was gone{G1831}, they caught{G1949}Paul{G3588} and{G2532} Silas{G3588}, and drew{G1670} them into{G1519} the marketplace{G3588} unto{G1909} the rulers{G3588},
And{G2532} brought{G4317} them{G846} to the magistrates{G3588}, saying{G2036}, These{G3778} men{G3588}, being{G5225} Jews{G2453}, do exceedingly trouble{G1613} our{G2257} city{G3588},
And{G2532} teach{G2605} customs{G1485}, which{G3739} are{G1832} not{G3756} lawful{G1832} for us{G2254} to receive{G3858}, neither{G3761} to observe{G4160}, being{G5607} Romans{G4514}.

And{G2532} the multitude{G3588} rose up together{G4911} against{G2596} them{G846}: and{G2532} the magistrates{G3588} rent off{G4048} their{G846} clothes{G3588}, and commanded{G2753} to beat{G4463} them.

And{G5037} when they had laid{G2007} many{G4183} stripes{G4127} upon them{G846}, they cast{G906} them into{G1519} prison{G5438}, charging{G3853} the jailor{G3588} to keep{G5083} them{G846} safely{G806}:

Who{G3739}, having received{G2983} such{G5108} a charge{G3852}, thrust{G906} them{G846} into{G1519} the inner{G2082} prison{G5438}, and{G2532} made{G805} their{G846} feet{G3588} fast{G805} in{G1519} the stocks{G3588}.
And{G1161} at{G2596} midnight{G3588} Paul{G3972} and{G2532} Silas{G4609} prayed{G4336}, and sang praises{G5214} unto God{G3588}: and{G1161} the prisoners{G3588} heard{G1874} them{G846}.

And{G1161} suddenly{G869} there was{G1096} a great{G3173} earthquake{G4578}, so that{G5620} the foundations{G3588} of the prison{G3588} were shaken{G4531}: and{G5037} immediately{G3916} all{G3956} the doors{G3588} were opened{G455}, and{G2532} every one's{G3956} bands{G3588} were loosed{G447}.

And{G1161} the keeper of the prison{G3588} awaking out{G1096} of his sleep{G1853}, and{G2532} seeing{G1492} the prison{G3588} doors{G3588} open{G455}, he drew out{G4685} his sword{G3162}, and would{G3195} have killed{G337} himself{G1438}, supposing that{G3543} the prisoners{G3588} had been fled{G1628}.
But{G1161} Paul{G3588} cried{G5455} with a loud{G3173} voice{G5456}, saying{G3004}, Do{G4238} thyself{G4572} no{G3367} harm{G2556}: for{G1063} we are{G2070} all{G537} here{G1759}.
Then{G1161} he called{G154} for a light{G5457}, and sprang in{G1530}, and{G2532} came{G1096} trembling{G1790}, and fell down{G4363} before Paul{G3588} and{G2532} Silas{G3588},
And{G2532} brought{G4254} them{G846} out{G1854}, and said{G5346}, Sirs{G2962}, what{G5101} must{G1163} I{G3165} do{G4160} to be{G2443} saved{G4982}?
And{G1161} they said{G2036}, Believe{G4100} on{G1909} the Lord{G3588} Jesus{G2424} Christ{G5547}, and{G2532} thou{G4771} shalt be saved{G4982}, and{G2532} thy{G4675} house{G3588}.
And{G2532} they spake{G2980} unto him{G846} the word{G3588} of the Lord{G3588}, and{G2532} to all{G3956} that were{G3588} in{G1722} his{G846} house{G3588}.

And{G2532} he took{G3880} them{G846} the same{G1565} hour{G3588} of the night{G3588}, and washed{G3068} their stripes{G3588}; and{G2532} was baptized{G907}, he{G846} and{G2532} all{G3956} his{G846}, straightway{G3916}.

And{G5037} when he had brought{G321} them{G846} into{G1519} his{G846} house{G3588}, he set{G3908} meat{G5132} before them{G3908}, and{G2532} rejoiced{G21}, believing{G4100} in God{G3588} with all his house{G3832}.
And{G1161} when{G1096} it was day{G2250}, the magistrates{G3588} sent{G649} the serjeants{G3588}, saying{G3004}, Let{G630} those{G1565} men{G3588} go{G630}.

And{G1161} the keeper of the prison{G3588} told{G518} this{G5128} saying{G3588} to{G4314} Paul{G3588}, The magistrates{G3588} have sent{G649} to{G2443} let you go{G630}: now{G3568} therefore{G3767} depart{G1831}, and go{G4198} in{G1722} peace{G1515}.

But{G1161} Paul{G3972} said{G5346} unto{G4314} them{G846}, They have beaten{G1194} us{G2248} openly{G1219} uncondemned{G178}, being{G5225} Romans{G4514}, and have cast{G906} us into{G1519} prison{G5438}; and{G2532} now{G3568} do they thrust{G1544} us{G2248} out{G1544} privily{G2977}? nay{G3756} verily{G1063}; but{G235} let them come{G2064} themselves{G846} and fetch{G1806} us{G2248} out{G1806}.NOTE! And{G1161} the serjeants{G3588} told{G312} these{G5023} words{G3588} unto the magistrates{G3588}: and{G2532} they feared{G5399}, when they heard{G191} that{G3754} they were{G1526} Romans{G4514}.
And{G2532} they came{G2064} and besought{G3870} them{G846}, and{G2532} brought{G1806} them out{G1806}, and desired{G2065} them to depart{G1831} out of the city{G3588}.

And{G1161} they went{G1831} out of{G1537} the prison{G3588}, and entered{G1525} into{G1519} the house of Lydia{G3588}: and{G2532} when they had seen{G1492} the brethren{G3588}, they comforted{G3870} them{G846}, and{G2532} departed{G1831}.
